entry.def: A semiconductor is a substance used in electronics whose ability to conduct electricity increases with greater heat.

means.word_mean: 1. a substance as germanium or silicon whose electrical conductivity is intermediate between that of a metal and an insulator; its conductivity increases with temperature and in the presence of impurities
2. a conductor made with semiconducting material
